result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs, PAC>=0.08, <0.15 (1st). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs, PAC>=0.08, <0.15 (1st) was dismissed by the court.

  • Sunil Kumar was found guilty of OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs due Dec 6, 2016. Failure to pay will result in one day in jail for every $25 outstanding.

Defendant must submit DNA sample while in custody.

Huber authorized.

from Attorney Piel regarding rescheduling of Jury Trial.  Scanned and forwarded as document for review to Branch 2 clerk.
Jury trial on June 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

State appears by Patti Wabitsch. Defendant Sunil Kumar in court with Attorney Walter Piel. Interpreter David Roberts in court. Interpreter Sunita Wadhwa in court. Interpreters sworn in. Atty Wabitsch addresses the court and testimony from detective excused. Atty Wabitsch requests interpreter not interpret the video for less confusion. Atty Wabitsch states on the record previous plea deal. Defendant wishes to proceed to trial. State requests witnesses be sequestered. Court orders sequestering before opening statements. 

9:20 am/Jurors report to courtroom and given oath.
9:21 am/Voir dire by the court.
9:32 am/Voir dire by Atty Wabitsch.
9:55 am/Voir dire by Atty Piel.
10:03 am/Jurors excused. Parties address court regarding jury panel. On agreement of counsel, court dismisses jury panel and trial rescheduled.
Next date picked off the record with Atty Wabitsch, Atty Piel and both interpreters. Jury trial rescheduled to June 14, 2016.
